case.title: Add account and profile records to database

custom.steps: 1. Add hinted values to input fields throughout all createAccountSequence screens. 1. Select okayButton on createAccountTenScreen.
custom.expected:
The database receives values for the following properties: 1. account 2. password 3. email_address 4. first_name 5. middle_name 6. last_name 7. date_of_birth 8. street_number 9. street_name 10. unit_number 11. floor_number 12. city 13. state 14. postal_code 15. country 16. telephone_country_code 17. telephone_area_code 18. telephone_number 19. occupation 20. industry
Response: ...

custom.steps: 1. Navigate to root URL (/) in browser (localhost:8080/ for local testing, mxfactorial.io/ for production testing).
custom.expected: The landingScreen displays: 1. mxfactorial 2. userInputField 3. passwordInputField 4. logInButton 5. createButon 6. forgotPasswordLink 7. zero warnings & errors in browser console

custom.steps: 1. Add TRUE credentials to userInputField and passwordInputField on landingScreen. 2. Select logInButton on landingScreen.
custom.expected: The homeScreen displays: 1. homeButton 2. notificationCounter 3. notificationFlag 4. mainNavMenuButton 5. debitorAccountBalanceDisplayCell 6. recipientAccountInputField with "user" placeholder hint 7. sumTransactionItemValueDisplayCell 8. addGoodOrServiceButton

custom.steps: 1. Display homeScreen. 2. Select mainNavMenuButton.
custom.expected: mainNavDropDownMenu displays: 1. mainNavMenuButton 2. mainNavAccountSettingsButton 3. mainNavRequestButton 4. mainNavHistoryButton 5. mainNavRulesButton 6. mainNavQueryButton 7. mainNavSupportButton 8. mainNavLogOutButton

custom.steps: 1. Select notificationFlag located at top left corner of screen after log in.
custom.expected: notificationDropDownMenu displays: 1. notificationCounter 2. notificationFlag 3. clearAllButton 4. a list of notificationDropDownMenuItem(s)

custom.steps: 1. Select notificationFlag located at top left corner of screen after log in to display notificationDropDownMenu. 2. Select anywhere else on screen EXCEPT notificationDropDownMenu.
custom.expected: notificationDropDownMenu dismissed.

custom.preconds: Receive web client notifications for transactions, transaction requests, and transaction rule requests during or prior to log in.
custom.steps: 1. Select notificationFlag after log in to display notificationDropDownMenu.
custom.expected: Each notificationDropDownMenuItem displays: 1. Human-readable relative time stamp (link to global requirement will be added later) 2. other account involved in event 3. notification type (transaction, request for transaction, request to add transaction rule) 4. transaction amount (sum quantity x value) 5. transaction direction, i.e. positive or negative

custom.steps: 1. Select notificationFlag after receiving notifications for transactions, transaction requests, and rule requests to display notificationDropDownMenu. 2. Select clearAllButton notificationDropDownMenu.
custom.expected: 1. /notify service records time stamps in received_time properties for all notificationDropDownMenuItem(s) displayed. 2. Unless a new notification is received, notificationCounter resets to 0 AFTER a new request to /notify confirms all notifications with sent_time values also have received_time values. 3. All notificationDropDownMenuItem(s) with updated notification records are removed from notificationDropDownMenu.

custom.steps: 1. Select createButton on landingScreen.
custom.expected: The createAccountOneScreen displays: 1. backButton linking to previous screen 2. the first portion of the systemaccounting Terms of Use 3. nextButton 4. zero warnings & errors in browser console

custom.steps: 1. Select nextButton on createAccountOneScreen.
custom.expected: The createAccountTwoScreen displays: 1. backButton 2. the second portion of the systemaccounting Terms of Use 3. nextButton 4. zero warnings & errors in browser console

custom.steps: 1. Select nextButton on createAccountTwoScreen.
custom.expected: The createAccountThreeScreen displays: 1. backButton 2. the third portion of the systemaccounting Terms of Use 3. iAcceptButton 4. zero warnings & errors in browser console

custom.steps: 1. Select iAcceptButton on createAccountThreeScreen.
custom.expected: The createAccountFourScreen displays: 1. backButton 2. helpButton 3. firstNameInputField 4. middleNameInputField 5. lastNameInputField 6. countryInputField 7. startOverButton 8. nextButton 9. zero warnings & errors in browser console

custom.steps: 1. Add hinted values to input fields on createAccountFourScreen (type-checking NOT performed here, but by negative cases). 2. Select nextButton on createAccountFourScreen.
custom.expected: The createAccountFiveScreen displays: 1. backButton 2. helpButton 3. streetNumberInputField 4. streetNameInputField 5. floorNumberInputField 6. buildingUnitInputField 7. startOverButton 8. nextButton 9. zero warnings & errors in browser console

custom.steps: 1. Add hinted values to input fields on createAccountFiveScreen (type-checking NOT performed here, but by negative cases). 2. Select nextButton on createAccountFiveScreen.
custom.expected: The createAccountSixScreen displays: 1. backButton 2. helpButton 3. cityInputField 4. stateInputField 5. postalCodeInputField 6. startOverButton 7. nextButton 8. zero warnings & errors in browser console

custom.steps: 1. Add hinted values to input fields on createAccountSixScreen (type-checking NOT performed here, but by negative cases). 2. Select nextButton on createAccountSixScreen.
custom.expected: The createAccountSixScreen displays: 1. backButton 2. helpButton 3. telephoneCountryCodeInputField 4. telephoneAreaCodeInputField 5. telephoneNumberInputField 6. startOverButton 7. nextButton 8. zero warnings & errors in browser console

custom.steps: 1. Add hinted values to input fields on createAccountSevenScreen (type-checking NOT performed here, but by negative cases). 2. Select nextButton on createAccountSevenScreen.
custom.expected: The createAccountEightScreen displays: 1. backButton 2. helpButton 3. dateOfBirthInputField 4. industryInputField 5. occupationInputField 6. startOverButton 7. nextButton 8. zero warnings & errors in browser console

custom.steps: 1. Add hinted values to input fields on createAccountEightScreen (type-checking NOT performed here, but by negative cases). 2. Select nextButton on createAccountEightScreen.
custom.expected: The createAccountNineScreen displays: 1. backButton 2. helpButton 3. userInputField 4. passwordInputField 5. emailAddressInputField 6. startOverButton 7. nextButton 8. zero warnings & errors in browser console

custom.steps: 1. Add hinted values to input fields on createAccountNineScreen (type-checking NOT performed here, but by negative cases). 2. Select nextButton on createAccountNineScreen.
custom.expected: The createAccountTenScreen displays: 1. backButton 2. helpButton 3. Verification email sent copy 4. okayButton

custom.steps: 1. Select okButton on createAccountTenScreen.
custom.expected: landingScreen is displayed. Create account input fields are empty (200 from POST /account clears webclient state).

custom.steps: 1. Log in to display homeScreen. 2. Select mainNavMenuButton. 3. Select mainNavAccountSettingsButton (gear icon).
custom.expected: accountSettingsScreen displays: 1. homeButton 2. notificationCounter 3. notificationFlagButton 4. mainNavMenuButton 5. emailAddressInputField 6. publishActivityCheckbox 7. passwordPerTransactionCheckbox 8. passwordPerRequestCheckbox 9. notifyOnPaymentReceiptCheckbox 10. notifyOnPaymentSentCheckbox 11. notifyOnRequestSentCheckbox 12. notifyOnRequestReceiptCheckbox 13. changePasswordButton 14. editProfileButton

custom.steps: 1. Display accountSettingsScreen. 2. Select editProfileButton.
custom.expected: editAccountProfileScreen displays: 1. homeButton 2. notificationCounter 3. notificationFlagButton 4. backButton 5. mainNavMenuButton 6. firstNameInputField 7. middleNameInputField 8. lastNameInputField 9. countryInputField 10. streetNumberInputField 11. streetNameInputField 12. floorNumberInputField 13. buildingUnitInputField 14. cityInputField 15. stateInputField 16. postalCodeInputField 17. telephoneCountryCodeInputField 18. telephoneAreaCodeInputField 19. telephoneNumberInputField 20. dateOfBirthInputField 21. industryInputField 22. occupationInputField 23. saveButton

custom.steps: 1. Display accountSettingsScreen. 2. Select changePasswordButton.
custom.expected: changePasswordPopup displays: 1. oldPasswordInputField 2. newPasswordInputField 3. confirmNewPasswordInputField 4. cancelButton 5. okButton

custom.steps: 1. Select changePasswordButton on accountSettingsScreen to display changePasswordPopup. 2. Add old password to oldPasswordInputField. 3. Add new password to newPasswordInputField. 4. Repeat new password in confirmNewPasswordInputField. 5. Select cancelButton.
custom.expected: 1. changePasswordPopup is dismissed. 2. accountSettingsScreen continues to display. 3. Password unchanged.

custom.steps: 1. Select changePasswordButton on accountSettingsScreen to display changePasswordPopup. 2. Add old password into oldPasswordInputField. 3. Add new password into newPasswordInputField. 4. Repeat new password into confirmNewPasswordInputField. 5. Select okButton.
custom.expected: passwordChangeSuccessfulPopup displays okButton.

custom.steps: 1. Change password to display changePasswordSuccessfulPopup. 2. Select okButton on changePasswordSuccessfulPopup.
custom.expected: 1. changePasswordSuccessfulPopup is dismissed. 2. accountSettingsScreen continues to display.

custom.steps: 1. Change password. 2. Log out. 3. Log in with new password.
custom.expected: homeScreen displays name of account in debitorAccountDisplayCell.

custom.steps: 1. Select editProfileButton on accountSettingsScreen to display editAccountProfileScreen. 2. Change values in all profile input fields. 3. Select saveButton.
custom.expected: passwordApproveEditProfilePopup displays: 1. editProfileDisplayCell 2. passwordInputField 3. cancelButton 4. okButton

custom.steps: 1. Select saveButton on editAccountProfileScreen after changing profile values. 2. Add TRUE password to passwordInputField on passwordApproveEditProfilePopup. 3. Select cancelButton on passwordApproveEditProfilePopup.
custom.expected: 1. passwordApproveEditProfilePopup is dismissed. 2. editAccountProfileScreen displays. 3. Account profile remains unchanged.

custom.steps: 1. Select saveButton on editAccountProfileScreen after changing profile values. 2. Add TRUE password to passwordInputField on passwordApproveEditProfilePopup. 3. Select saveButton on passwordApproveEditProfilePopup.
custom.expected: editProfileSuccessfulPopup displays with okButton.

custom.steps: 1. Select saveButton on editAccountProfileScreen after changing profile values. 2. Add TRUE password to passwordInputField on passwordApproveeditProfilePopup. 3. Select saveButton on passwordApproveeditProfilePopup to display editProfileSuccessfulPopup. 4. Select okButton on editProfileSuccessfulPopup.
custom.expected: editAccountProfileScreen displays after editProfileSuccessfulPopup is dismissed.

custom.steps: 1. Edit email address inside emailAddressInputField on accountSettingsScreen. 2. Remove cursor from emailAddressInputField by selecting elsewhere on screen.
custom.expected: confirmEmailAddressChangePopup displays: 1. confirmEmailAddressChangeInputField 2. cancelButton 3. okButton

custom.steps: 1. Edit email address inside emailAddressInputField on accountSettingsScreen and remove cursor to display confirmEmailAddressChangePopup. 2. Select cancelButton on confirmEmailAddressChangePopup.
custom.expected: 1. confirmEmailAddressChangePopup is dismissed. 2. Email address unchanged. 3. accountSettingsScreen is displayed.

custom.steps: 1. Edit email address inside emailAddressInputField on accountSettingsScreen and remove cursor to display confirmEmailAddressChangePopup. 2. Select okButton on confirmEmailAddressChangePopup.
custom.expected: 1. emailVerificationSentForEmailAdressChangePopup displays okButton. 2. Account profile object added to array in database with new email address.

custom.steps: 1. Edit email address inside emailAddressInputField on accountSettingsScreen and remove cursor to display confirmEmailAddressChangePopup. 2. Select okButton on confirmEmailAddressChangePopup to display emailVerificationSentForEmailAdressChangePopup. 3. Select okButton on emailVerificationSentForEmailAdressChangePopup.
custom.expected: emailVerificationSentForEmailAdressChangePopup is dismissed. accountSettingsScreen is displayed.

case.title: confirmEmailAddressChangePopup NOT displayed after email address is unchanged

custom.steps: 1. Insert cursor inside emailAddressInputField on accountSettingsScreen. 2. Remove or change characters, then restore characters WITHOUT changing the email address, e.g. change person@email.com to pers@email.com, then back to person@email.com. 3. Remove cursor from emailAddressInputField by selecting elsewhere on accountSettingsScreen.
custom.expected: confirmEmailAddressChangePopup NOT displayed because a difference check inside the emailAddressInputField confirmed the string was NOT altered.

case.title: passwordApproveEditProfilePopup NOT displayed after profile is unchanged

custom.steps: 1. Select editProfileButton on accountSettingsScreen to display editAccountProfileScreen. 2. Remove or change, then restore characters WITHOUT changing the values inside the profile input fields, e.g. change New York to Los Angeles, then back to New York. 3. Select saveButton.
custom.expected: 1. passwordApproveEditProfilePopup NOT displayed after a difference check confirms profile values are unchanged. 2. New account_profile object NOT added to array in database. 3. editProfileAccountProfileScreen continues to display.

custom.steps: 1. Select addGoodOrServiceButton on homeScreen to display transactionItemNameInputField, transactionItemValueInputField, transactionItemQuantityInputField. 2. Add name of item into transactionItemNameInputField, e.g. "milk". 3. Add value of item into transactionItemValueInputField, e.g. "3.5". 4. Add quantity of item into transactionItemQuantityInputField, e.g. "2". 5. Select addGoodOrServiceButton on homeScreen to display an additional transactionItemNameInputField, transactionItemValueInputField, transactionItemQuantityInputField. 6. Add name of item into transactionItemNameInputField, e.g. "bread". 7. Add value of item into transactionItemValueInputField, e.g. "3.0". 8. Add quantity of item into transactionItemQuantityInputField, e.g. "3".
custom.expected: sumTransactionItemValueDisplayCell = SUM (transactionItemValueInputField x transactionItemQuantityInputField) of all transaction items, e.g. 16.000 = (3.5 x 2) + (3.0 x 3)

custom.steps: 1. Add account into recipientAccountInputField to identify user receiving payment on homeScreen. 2. Add multiple transaction items. 3. Select transactButton on homeScreen.
custom.expected: passwordApproveTransactionPopup displays: 1. sumTransactionItemValueDisplayCell = homeScreen sumTransactionItemValueDisplayCell 2. passwordInputField 3. cancelButton 4. okButton

custom.steps: 1. Add account into recipientAccountInputField to identify user receiving payment on homeScreen. 2. Add multiple transaction items. 3. Select transactButton on homeScreen to display passwordApproveTransactionPopup. 4. Add TRUE password into passwordInputField on passwordApproveTransactionPopup. 5. Select cancelButton on passwordApproveTransactionPopup.
custom.expected: 1. passwordApproveTransactionPopup is dismissed. 2. homeScreen is displayed. 3. Transaction NOT posted.

custom.steps: 1. Add account into recipientAccountInputField to identify user receiving payment on homeScreen. 2. Add multiple transaction items. 3. Select transactButton on homeScreen to display passwordApproveTransactionPopup. 4. Add TRUE password into passwordInputField on passwordApproveTransactionPopup. 5. Select okButton on passwordApproveTransactionPopup.
custom.expected: The historyScreen displays: 1. a new historyItemDisplayCell 2. transactionSuccessfulPopup 3. cancelButton on transactionSuccessfulPopup 4. okButton on transactionSuccessfulPopup

case.title: Failure of transact API on passwordApproveTransactionPopup

custom.steps: 1. Add account into recipientAccountInputField to identify user receiving payment on homeScreen. 2. Add multiple transaction items. 3. Select transactButton on homeScreen to display passwordApproveTransactionPopup. 4. Add TRUE password into passwordInputField on passwordApproveTransactionPopup. 5. Simulate a failure of the /transaction API. 6. Select okButton on passwordApproveTransactionPopup.
custom.expected: "Transaction failed" displays below the passwordInputField on the passwordApproveTransactionPopup.

custom.steps: 1. Add account into recipientAccountInputField to identify user receiving payment on homeScreen. 2. Add multiple transaction items. 3. Select transactButton on homeScreen to display passwordApproveTransactionPopup. 4. Avoid adding password into passwordInputField on passwordApproveTransactionPopup. 5. Select okButton on passwordApproveTransactionPopup.
custom.expected: "Password required" displays below the passwordInputField on the passwordApproveTransactionPopup.

custom.steps: 1. Complete transaction. 2. Select okButton on passwordApproveTransactionPopup.
custom.expected: 1. passwordApproveTransactionPopup dismissed. 2. historyScreen displays.

custom.steps: 1. Complete transaction to display passwordApproveTransactionPopup on historyScreen. 2. Select newButton on passwordApproveTransactionPopup.
custom.expected: homeScreen displays.

custom.steps: 1. Select mainNavMenuButton on homeScreen. 2. Select mainNavRequestButton on mainNavDropDownMenu.
custom.expected: requestScreen displays: 1. a button group containing a rejectedButton & an activeButton (default) 2. a list of requestItemDisplayCell(s) sorted according to most recent request received, and filtered according to rejectedButton & activeButton state

custom.steps: 1. Select mainNavMenuButton on homeScreen. 2. Select mainNavRequestButton on mainNavDropDownMenu. 3. Select activeButton on requestScreen.
custom.expected: requestScreen displays requestItemDisplayCell(s) where transaction.rejected_time does NOT exist AND current time < transaction.expiration_time.

custom.preconds: Create multiple debiting & crediting requests. Expire a fraction of the debiting & crediting requests.
custom.steps: 1. Select mainNavMenuButton on homeScreen. 2. Select mainNavRequestButton on mainNavDropDownMenu. 3. Select rejectedButton on requestScreen.
custom.expected: requestScreen displays requestItemDisplayCell(s) where transaction.rejected_time EXISTS OR current time >= transaction.expiration_time.

custom.steps: 1. Add account into recipientAccountInputField on homeScreen to identify user sending payment. 2. Add multiple transaction items. 3. Select requestButton on homeScreen.
custom.expected: addExpirationTimePopup displays: 1. expirationDateInputField 2. cancelButton 3. okButton

custom.steps: 1. Add account into recipientAccountInputField on homeScreen to identify user sending payment. 2. Add multiple transaction items. 3. Select requestButton on homeScreen to display addExpirationTimePopup. 4. Add date to expirationDateInputField in addExpirationTimePopup. 5. Select okButton.
custom.expected:
requestSentPopup displays: 1. historyButton 2. okButton
*Note: Client timezone must be identified to enable an equivalent server-generated time stamp (/transaction does NOT CRUD client time stamps for execution).

case.title: Receiving transaction request AFTER log in increases notificationCounter by 1

custom.steps: 1. Log in to display homeScreen. 2. Receive transaction request from another account to trigger an 'ask200' webclient notification from the /notify service.
custom.expected: notificationCounter on homeScreen immediately increases by 1.

case.title: Receiving transaction request BEFORE log in increases notificationCounter by 1

custom.preconds: Receive notifications for transactions, transaction requests, and transaction rule requests to produce an initial notificationCounter > 0.
custom.steps: 1. Log in to display homeScreen. 2. Observe notificationCounter's initial integer. 3. Log out. 4. Receive transaction request from another account to trigger an 'ask200' webclient notification from the /notify service. 5. Log in.
custom.expected: notificationCounter increased by 1.

case.title: Receiving transaction request AFTER log in adds notificationMenuDropDownMenuItem

custom.steps: 1. Log in to display homeScreen. 2. Select notificationFlag to display notificationDropDownMenu. 3. Receive transaction request from another account to trigger an 'ask200' webclient notification from the /notify service.
custom.expected: notificationDropDownMenuItem added to top of notificationDropDownMenu.

case.title: Receiving transaction request BEFORE log in adds notificationMenuDropDownMenuItem

custom.steps: 1. Log in to display homeScreen. 2. Select notificationFlag to display notificationDropDownMenu. 3. Observe initial list of notificationDropDownMenuItem(s). 4. Log out. 5. Send transaction request from another account to trigger an 'ask200' webclient notification from /notify service. 6. Log in. 7. Select notificationFlag.
custom.expected: Top of notificationDropDownMenu displays new notificationDropDownMenuItem.

custom.steps: 1. Select mainNavMenuButton on homeScreen. 2. Select mainNavRequestButton on mainNavDropDownMenu to display requestScreen.
custom.expected: requestItemDisplayCell displays: 1. Human-readable relative time stamp (link to global requirement will be added later) 2. other account involved in event 3. request type (transaction, transaction rule) 4. transaction amount (sum quantity x value) or rule ID 5. transaction direction, i.e. positive or negative

custom.steps: 1. Select requestItemDisplayCell on requestScreen.
custom.expected: requestDetailScreen displays: 1. homeButton 2. notificationCounter 3. notificationFlag 4. mainNavMenu 5. backButton 6. creditorAccountDisplayCell 7. sumTransactionItemValueDisplayCell 8. transactionTimeDisplayCell 9. expirationTimeDisplayCell 10. transactButton 11. rejectButton 12. a list of transactionItemDisplayCell(s) each identifying the quanity, value, and name of a transaction_item 13. transactionIdDisplayCell 14. preTransactionBalanceDisplayCell

custom.steps: 1. Select transactButton on requestDetailScreen.
custom.expected: passwordApproveTransactionPopup displays: 1. sumTransactionItemValueDisplayCell = transactionRequestDetailScreen sumTransactionItemValueDisplayCell 2. passwordInputField 3. cancelButton 4. okButton
custom.req_supplementals: *Drive folder for passwordApproveTransactionPopup available under homeScreen folder.

custom.steps: 1. Select mainNavMenuButton on homeScreen. 2. Select mainNavRequestButton on mainNavDropDownMenu to display requestScreen. 3. Select transactionRequestItemDisplayCell on requestScreen to display requestDetailScreen. 4. Select transactButton on requestDetailScreen to display passwordApproveTransactionPopup. 4. Add TRUE password into passwordInputField on passwordApproveTransactionPopup. 5. Select okButton on passwordApproveTransactionPopup.
custom.expected: The historyScreen displays: 1. a new historyItemDisplayCell 2. transactionSuccessfulPopup 3. cancelButton on transactionSuccessfulPopup 4. okButton on transactionSuccessfulPopup
custom.req_supplementals: *Drive folder for transactionSuccessfulPopUp available under homeScreen folder.

case.title: requestDetailScreen decreases notificationCounter by 1 and removes notificationDropDownMenuItem from notificationDropDownMenu

custom.preconds: Receive a notification for a transaction request to produce an initial notificationCounter > 0.
custom.steps: 1. Select requestItemDisplayCell on requestScreen.
custom.expected: 1. requestDetailScreen displays. 2. Display of requestDetailScreen triggers request to /notify to add a time stamp to received_time property. 3. notificationCounter decreases by 1 (triggered by 200 from /notify; NOT selection of notificationDropDownMenuItem on notificationDropDownMenu). 4. Related notificationDropDownMenuItem is removed from notificationDropDownMenu (triggered by 200 from /notify; NOT selection of notificationDropDownMenuItem on notificationDropDownMenu).

custom.preconds: Receive a notification for a transaction request to increase notificationCounter by 1 and add a notificationDropDownMenuItem to notificationDropDownMenu.
custom.steps: 1. Select notificationFlag after log in to display notificationDropDownMenu. 2. Select notificationDropDownMenuItem for transaction request.
custom.expected: 1. notificationDropDownMenu dismissed. 2. requestDetailScreen displays. 3. notificationCounter decreases by 1 (triggered by display of related requestDetailScreen; NOT selection of notificationDropDownMenuItem on notificationDropDownMenu). 4. Related notificationDropDownMenuItem is removed from notificationDropDownMenu (triggered by display of requestDetailScreen; NOT selection of notificationDropDownMenuItem on notificationDropDownMenu). 5. /notify records time stamp for received_time.

case.title: Decreased notificationCounter and removed notificationDropDownMenuItem unchanged after log out and log in

custom.steps: 1. Decrease notificationCounter and remove notificationDropDownMenuItem by displaying related requestDetailScreen. 2. Log out. 3. Log in.
custom.expected: 1. notificationCounter unchanged. 2. notificationDropDownMenuItem remains absent from notificationDropDownMenu.

custom.steps: 1. Select rejectButton on requestDetailScreen.
custom.expected: areYouCertainPopup displays: 1. cancelButton 2. yesButton

custom.steps: 1. Select rejectButton on requestDetailScreen to display areYouCertainPopup. 2. Select cancelButton on areYouCertainPopup.
custom.expected: 1. areYouCertainPopup dismissed. 2. /transaction NOT requested to add time stamp to rejection_time property of transaction record. 2. Transaction remains listed as active on requestScreen.

custom.steps: 1. Select rejectButton on requestDetailScreen to display areYouCertainPopup. 2. Select yesButton on areYouCertainPopup to request /transaction to add rejection_time property & time stamp to transact record.
custom.expected: 1. /transaction returns 200. 2. requestScreen displays rejectedButton state, and sorted according to most recent rejected (newly-rejected request at top of list). 3. transactionRejectedPopup displaying an okButton and newButton.

custom.steps: 1. Reject transaction request. 2. Select newButton on transactionRejectedPopup.
custom.expected: homeScreen displays.

custom.steps: 1. Reject transaction request. 2. Select okButton on transactionRejectedPopup.
custom.expected: 1. transactionRejectedPopup dismissed. 2. requestScreen displays rejectedButton state, and sorted according to most recent rejected (newly-rejected request at top of list).

custom.steps: 1. Select mainNavMenuButton on homeScreen to display mainNavDropDownMenu. 2. Select mainNavHistoryButton.
custom.expected: historyScreen displays: 1. homeButton 2. notificationCounter 3. notificationFlag 4. mainNavMenu 5. debitorAccountBalanceDisplayCell 6. a historyItemDisplayCell for every transaction existing in account's history

custom.steps: 1. Select historyItemDisplayCell on historyScreen.
custom.expected: historyDetailScreen displays: 1. homeButton 2. notificationCounter 3. notificationFlag 4. mainNavMenu 5. backButton 6. creditorAccountDisplayCell 7. sumTransactionItemValueDisplayCell 8. transactionTimeDisplayCell 9. a list of transactionItemDisplayCell(s) each identifying the quanity, value, and name of a transaction_item 10. trsInstanceIdDisplayCell 11. preTransactionBalanceDisplayCell 12. concurrentTransactionValueDisplay 13. postTransactionBalanceDisplayCell 14. disputeTransactionButton

custom.steps: 1. Select first historyItemDisplayCell on historyScreen. 2. Select the backButton. 3. Select second historyItemDisplayCell on historyScreen. 4. Select the backButton .
custom.expected: historyScreen displayed twice. Both historyItemDisplayCell(s) displayed their corresponding historyDetailScreen(s).
